Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] was dismissed by the court.

  • Chad James Sorensen was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
Court grants 74 days credit.

superMiscConds.notes:
Fine to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.

If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
Blood draw fee to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision. To be forwarded to City of Oconomowoc Police Dept. once received.
Maintain full time employment and/or school.
Submit to an AODA  Asssessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Submit to random alcohol/drug screens.
Not to use or possess of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription or any drug paraphernalia.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed.
Not to be present on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol. (taverns, bars, pubs or liquor stores)
Do not operate unless you are properly licensed.
Ignition Interlock Device to be installed.
Provide DNA sample if not already done so.

supervisions.notes: Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Chad James Sorensen in court, in custody, with attorney Joseph Smith.  


Defendant enters a plea of No Contest to count 1.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of count 1.
Count 2 is dismissed as a read in.
Count 3 is dismissed by operation of law.


Court orders the following:
Total Prison:  51 Months.
Initial Confinement:  15 Months.
Extended Supervision:  36 Months.
74 Days Credit.

36 Months D/L REVOCATION
36 Months IGNITION INTERLOCK

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e bars, taverns, or liquor stores).
Ignition Interlock Device installed.  
Do not drive or operate a motor vehicle without a valid license.
DNA sample to be provided.

FINE: $2,327
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  $250
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
BLOOD DRAW FEE:  $35 (to be paid as a condition of extended supervision - to be forward to City of Oconomowoc Police Department);
TRANSCRIPT FEE:  $16  paid through Waukesha County Circuit Court to be forward to District Attorney.
To be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.

Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program. 

Other:  AODA ASSESSMENT AND FOLLOW THROUGH.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.


Defendant to be transfered to DCI - FORTHWITH.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 10-27-2015 11:30 am

COURT ORDERED A $4995.00 CASH BOND IN ADDITION TO A $1000.00 SIGNATURE BOND. Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Defendant to be released directly/only to Wisconsin Community Services personnel to set-up SCRAM monitoring.  Defendant ordered to SCRAM monitoring. Defendant Chad James Sorensen in court, in custody, with attorney Joseph Smith.   Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for preliminary hearing.  City of Oconomowoc Police Officer Krogmann sworn and testifies on direct by Attorney Bayer.  Exhibit #1 marked, offered and received.  Cross examination by Attorney Smith.  Court questions the witness.  Redirect by Attorney Bayer.  State rests and moves for bind over.   Court find probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Attorney Smith requests a modification of bail conditions to allow Huber bailee status.  Attorney Bayer does not object, however requests the defendant sign an additional signature bond.   The Court granted the Motion to Modify Bail.  Hearing scheduled for September 28, 2015 at 09:30 am.
